thread.title: Feud continues: Arkansas' Bielema on claim by Tech's Kliff Kingsbury that he got 'ass kicked'
thread.title_full: Feud continues: Arkansas' Bielema on claim by Tech's Kliff Kingsbury that he got 'ass kicked' | Dallas Morning News

author: Mike DuPont
title: Feud continues: Arkansas' Bielema on claim by Tech's Kliff Kingsbury that he got 'ass kicked'
text:
Kliff Kingsbury had choice words for Arkansas head coach Bret Bielema following Texas Tech's 35-24 win on Saturday in Fayetteville. Today, coach Bielema chose to respond.
"If that was an ass kicking, I'd love to see what last year was," Bielema said of Kingsbury, according to The Associated Press . "I'm happy he got to vent."
Bielema was making reference to the Razorbacks winning 49-28 against the Red Raiders last season in Lubbock.
After defeating Arkansas in their stadium last weekend, Kingsbury issued comments directed at Bielema in response to comments made by Bielema at a Texas High School Coaches convention.
"He stood up and said, 'if you don't throw to the fullback, we'll kick your ass and if you throw it 70 times a game, we'll kick your ass,'" Kingsbury said in the postgame press conference. "He just got his ass kicked twice in a row and probably next week by (Texas) A&M, as well."
Texas Tech's head coach was eager to leave the comments in the past and move forward to Saturday's matchup against No. 3 TCU during his weekly press conference on Monday.
"I've moved on from it," Kingsbury said. "What was said was said and we're getting ready for TCU."
Bielema added he wasn't referencing Kingsbury individually, but instead sharing his views of spread offenses.
Bielema on Kingsbury: "Itâ™s like, 'Come on, brother, donâ™t be so sensitive. Weâ™re talking football here. Not about you in particular.â™"
— Bo Mattingly (@SportsTalkwBo) September 21, 2015 Kingsbury and Bielema are 1-1 against each other all-time as head coaches, but don't expect the two to exchange any phone calls soon regarding re-scheduling.
Bielema on Kliff Kingsbury: "We werenâ™t talking before, and we probably wonâ™t talk now."
— Bo Mattingly (@SportsTalkwBo) September 21, 2015 Follow Mike DuPont on Twitter: @MikeDuPont_
